required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oxygenation by 100% Oxygen Via High Flow Nasal Cannula in Surgical Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Oxygenation by 100% Oxygen Via High Flow Nasal Cannula During Apnea in Adult Elective Surgical ENT Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Oxygenation with high-flow nasal cannula with 100% oxygen has only been evaluated in a limited number of studies. Although data are convincing it is of importance to evaluate this new concept in our department before implementing it into clinical practice.
The general purpose of this project is to evaluate a new ventilation strategy during ENT-surgery based on oxygenation with high-flow nasal cannula with 100% oxygen with focus on gas exchange.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to end of apnoea oxygenation or max 30 minutes
From start of anaesthesia to end of apnoea oxygenation or max 30 minutes
From start of anaesthesia to end of apnoea oxygenation or max 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Does hyperventilation prior to anaesthesia and apnoea oxygenation cause any difference in pCO2 in the end of the apnea (i.e. at up to 30 minutes) compared to normoventilation?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the end of the apnoea period, i.e. at approximately 20 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Does hyperventilation prior to anaesthesia and apnoea oxygenation cause any difference in pH in the end of the apnea (i.e. at up to 30 minutes) compared to normoventilation?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the end of the apnoea period, i.e. at approximately 20 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Does hyperventilation prior to anaesthesia and apnoea oxygenation cause any difference in pO2 in the end of the apnea (i.e. at up to 30 minutes) compared to normoventilation?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the end of the apnoea period, i.e. at approximately 20 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Does the high oxygen content cause atelectasis measures as change in relation between pCO2 and end tidal carbon dioxide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge from the postoperative unit, often max 2 hours

arm_group.description: The patients will be normoventilated before anesthesia
Prior to anesthesia, the patients will hyperventilate during 2 mins or until symptoms from the central nervous system (e.g. dizziness).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult, >18 years old
2. ENT-surgery where apnea is of benefit for the surgeon (eg. intraoral or laryngeal surgery) and the anesthesia time is <40 mins.
3. Capable of understanding the study information and sign the written consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. ASA>2
2. NYHA >2
3. BMI >30
4. Pregnancy
5. Manifest cardiac failure or coronary disease
6. Neuromuscular disease

overall_official.affiliation: Karolinska University Hospital and Karolinska Institutet
